com.googlecode.android4cs2.stringlights
Class BulbView

java.lang.Object
  ImageView
      com.googlecode.android4cs2.stringlights.BulbView

public class BulbView
extends ImageView

BulbView is a subclass of ImageView which is an implementation of the OnGestureListener interface. It contains information about the light bulb and handles all changes to the bulb's state through the user interface.

Author:
jdjennin
See Also:
ImageView, GestureDetector

Method Detail

onTouchEvent

public boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event)
Defines what to do in the case of a Touch Event. In this View, we pass the event to our GestureDetector.

Parameters:
event - The MotionEvent which triggered this callback.
Returns:
boolean
See Also:
MotionEvent

onDown

public boolean onDown(MotionEvent event)
Defines what to do when one's finger touches the screen. It must return true if one hopes to accomplish anything when touch events happen.

Parameters:
event - The MotionEvent which triggered this callback--here, a finger touching the screen.
Returns:
boolean
See Also:
MotionEvent

onFling

public boolean onFling(MotionEvent event,
                       MotionEvent arg1,
                       float arg2,
                       float arg3)
Defines what to do when a finger is flung across the screen. We don't care about that here.

onLongPress

public void onLongPress(MotionEvent event)
Defines what to do when a finger is held down for a prolonged period. Don't care.

onScroll

public boolean onScroll(MotionEvent event,
                        MotionEvent arg1,
                        float arg2,
                        float arg3)
Defines what to do when a finger scrolls on the screen. Don't care.

onShowPress

public void onShowPress(MotionEvent event)
Defines what to do when the user puts a finger on the screen.

onSingleTapUp

public boolean onSingleTapUp(MotionEvent event)
Defines what to do when a single touch was performed by the user on the screen. In this case, we turn the bulb off and on based on its current status.

Parameters:
event - The tap which triggered this callback.
Returns:
boolean
See Also:
MotionEvent

randomize

public void randomize()
Creates a new ColoredLight with the same state as the original but with a random color.

turnOn

public void turnOn()
Turns on the bulb associated with the current view. Sets its image resource accordingly, then invalidates the View so that it is redrawn.

turnOff

public void turnOff()
Turns off the bulb associated with the current view. Sets its image resource accordingly, then invalidates the View so that it is redrawn.

isOn

public boolean isOn()
Returns the current status of the bulb associated with this View.

Returns:
boolean
